item.description:
In July, Warsaw Park in Ansonia is the host for the Renaissance Festival.

More details will be given closer the that date.

http://www.thescrf.co...

www.thescrf.com/

If other members are going on a different date, then let me know so that
I can schedule another Meet Up.

Directions

From Fairfield County/New York I-95
I-95 North to Exit 27A (Route 8 North)
Follow Route 8 North
Road will split Route 25/Route 8, stay to the right for Route 8
Take Exit 16 Pershing Drive.
Take right at first light (Division Street)
Start up the hill and cross the river to light. (Shell Station on left)
Continue forward (Elm Street), road will wind to the right (Police station on left)
Follow road as it winds uphill.
At stop sign, turn right onto Route 243.
Secondary parking will be on the right at Ansonia High School. Faire is on the left.

From New Haven
From Whalley Avenue take left onto Fountain Street.
Fountain Street becomes Pulaski Highway (Route 243).
Follow for 4.8 miles. Faire is on right.
Secondary parking on left at Ansonia High School.

From Route 63/69 (North of New Haven)
Both routes going South merge onto Whalley Avenue.
Take a right onto Dayton Road (Route 122)(approximately 7 streets).
Take a right onto Route 243.
Follow for 4.8 miles. Faire is on right.
Secondary parking on left at Ansonia High School.

From Route 10
From Route 10, take right onto Whalley Avenue.
Take left onto Fountain Street.
Fountain Street becomes Route 243 Pulaski highway.
Follow for 4.8 miles. Faire is on right.
Secondary parking is at Ansonia High school on the left.

From Milford/Orange
Take Racebrook Road (Route 114 North)
Turn left onto Route 243 in Woodbridge
Travel approximately 1.5 miles, faire will be on the right

Mike B
item.why: Who wants to time travel into King Arthurs time.
item.name: Coffee Talk Goes Back In Time in Ansonia for Coffee on July 26
